tasks.task: Farmer dealing with drought and crop loss
subtasks: Wake up early (morning routine)
Evaluate crop condition (corn and soybeans in drought)
Decision to cut down (abandon) corn crop to prevent total loss
Cut down corn crop (physical action, harvesting)
Use cut corn for animal feed (agricultural decision)
Hope for insurance settlement (insurance claims process)
Reflect on family farm legacy (family business & emotions)

tasks.task: Drought impact on wider agriculture and infrastructure
subtasks: Consider significance of corn and soybeans as primary income (farmers' livelihood)
Note corn's unusability due to extreme dryness (crop failure signs)
Assess historical context of drought (recurring issue, long-term effects)
Acknowledge potential loss of soybeans due to similar conditions (extension of problem)
Evaluate farm's future survival (business continuity planning for farms)

tasks.task: Impact on Mississippi River transportation
subtasks: Understand the Mississippi River's economic importance (transportation artery)
Recognize recent history of the river (flooding vs. current low water)
Describe challenges posed by low water levels (dredging, marking, reduced barge loads)
Highlight critical role of the Army Corps of Engineers in managing river conditions
